items.description:
Scope of Work:
• Supply and deliver a new window unit as specified, 1x twin double-hung window 
• Sized at 52h x 59w
• Carefully remove any existing windows in the designated location.
• Set and install the new window unit into the prepared framed openings.
• Ensure each unit is properly leveled, plumb, and square for correct operation and long-term performance.
• Secure the windows according to the manufacturer's specifications and all applicable
building code requirements.
• Apply flashing and seal all perimeters with high-quality exterior-grade sealant to ensure a watertight installation.
• Fabricate and install new composite exterior trim in a picture-frame style with clean, mitered corners around each unit for a precise, professional, and finished appearance.
• Inspect all completed work to confirm proper function, weather sealing, and exterior finish quality. 

Framing Coordination:
Any minor framing adjustments required for proper window installation will be
addressed as part of the scope. If any significant modifications are necessary, they will be brought to the homeowner’s attention before proceeding. All framing details and final window sizes will be carefully coordinated and confirmed before ordering to ensure a proper fit and avoid any installation issues.

• If interior trim replacement is required, new trim will be selected to match the existing profile best and finish as closely as possible

items.name: Unnamed Product

items.description:
Siding Installation & Integration

Scope of Work
• Install new siding within an approximately 10 ft x 5 ft area where siding has already been removed.
• Inspect exposed wall sheathing for any visible deficiencies before installation.
• Install siding selected to best match the existing siding profile, exposure, and color as closely as possible.
• Integrate new siding into the surrounding existing siding to provide a uniform and seamless exterior appearance.
• Reinstall or replace J-channel and trim components as required to ensure proper drainage and a finished look.

Underlayment & Weather Protection

• Inspect existing house wrap or underlayment within the exposed area.
• Install new weather-resistant barrier (WRB / house wrap) where missing, damaged, or required to complete the siding repair.
• Properly lap and integrate the new WRB with the existing WRB above and on all sides to maintain continuity.
• Flash and seal all seams, fasteners, and transition points to protect against air and moisture infiltration.
• Integrate WRB and flashing with the door opening and surrounding trim to ensure a water-tight assembly.
items.name: Unnamed Product

items.description:
Door Picture Framing Composite Trim

Scope of Work
• Supply and install composite trim boards to picture-frame the existing exterior door.
• Trim to be installed plumb, level, and securely fastened for a clean, finished appearance.
• Install new J-channel around the perimeter of the composite trim to properly receive and terminate adjacent siding.
• Integrate trim and J-channel with surrounding siding and weather-resistant barrier to ensure proper drainage.
• Seal all joints, seams, and fastening points with exterior-grade sealant to prevent moisture intrusion.
• Composite trim selected for durability, low maintenance, and resistance to rot and weathering.
